channel.title: Help a noob learning JS with some external JS
channel.description:
ok so I'm learning JS and want to use exterrnal JS in the classic Heloo world test as i find it's easier to learn as much as possible in that first stage, BUT i have a problem my external JS isn't executing and i have no idea why, can someone please help?
[b]Main page:[/b] [code]<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN" "htp://www.w3.org/TR/html4.transitional.dtd"> <html> <head>
<script src="xxx.js"></script>
<title>matt's JS test</title>
</head>
<body>
</body> </html> [/code]
and here's my external JS sheet: [code] <script type="text/javascript"> document.write("Hi World!") </script> [/code]
I added the </script> attribute to the external sheet to see if it would work after not having it there at first.

item.title: Help a noob learning JS with some external JS
item.dc:creator: @Hamster Hamster
item.description:
@Hamster wrote:

function Hello() {
document.write("Hi World!");
}

you dont need that.. cous the document.write is enough

try putting this in your js file:

function Hello() {
  document.write("Hi World!");
}

and then change the to

item.title: Help a noob learning JS with some external JS
item.dc:creator: @maleficus maleficus
item.description:
@maleficus wrote:

ok so I'm learning JS and want to use exterrnal JS in the classic Heloo world test as i find it's easier to learn as much as possible in that first stage, BUT i have a problem my external JS isn't executing and i have no idea why, can someone please help?

Main page:

<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN"
    "htp://www.w3.org/TR/html4.transitional.dtd">
<html>
<head>
<script src="xxx.js"></script>
<title>matt's JS test</title>
</head>
<body>
</body>
</html>

and here's my external JS sheet:

<script type="text/javascript">
document.write("Hi World!")
</script>

I added the attribute to the external sheet to see if it would work after not having it there at first.

Read full topic
item.source: Help a noob learning JS with some external JS
